      • getBean

        public final <T> T getBean(java.lang.Class<T> theClass)
                throws ConfigurationLoader.ConfigurationLoaderException
        Description copied from interface: ConfigurationLoader
        Responsible for loading and returning a Plain Old Java Object (POJO) of the given class.
        Specified by:
        getBean in interface ConfigurationLoader
        Parameters:
        theClass - the type of the POJO which should hold the configuration
        Returns:
        a valid POJO which holds the loaded configuration parameters
        Throws:
        ConfigurationLoader.ConfigurationLoaderException - if something unrecoverable went wrong during the processing
        See Also:
        ConfigurationLoader.setBean(Class, Object)

      • setBean

        public <T> T setBean(java.lang.Class<T> theClass,
            T bean)
          throws ConfigurationLoader.ConfigurationLoaderException
        Description copied from interface: ConfigurationLoader
        Does the same thing as the #getBean(Class, InputStream) method, except that the POJO bean is provided.

        This method is especially useful, when a pre-defined configuration should be overwritten.

        Specified by:
        setBean in interface ConfigurationLoader
        Parameters:
        theClass - the type of the POJO which should hold the configuration
        bean - an already instantiated bean, which will be updated
        Returns:
        a valid POJO which holds the loaded configuration parameters
        Throws:
        ConfigurationLoader.ConfigurationLoaderException - if something unrecoverable went wrong during the processing
        See Also:
        #getBean(Class, InputStream)
